prototype

Prototype is a design pattern that lets an object, be able to create copies of itself with a method named clone.

This is particularly useful when you want to instantiate an object multiple times but you don’t want to call the codes in __init__() of the class. for example there maybe a call to an API, or connection to a database that you want to avoid to happen for multiple times.

How it works

  1. Import the Prototype class from the package

    from core.design_patterns.prototype import Prototype

  2. Create a prototype object, and put a print statement in the __init__()

    class MyPrototype(Prototype):

    def __init__(self,val):
        self.val = val
        print("prototype object instantiated with value {0}".format(val))

  3. Instantiate the object and you see the print statement goes off.

    instance = MyPrototype(val=10) # prototype object instantiated with value 10

  4. Now create a copy of this instance using clone method. You can also overwrite this method if needed.

    copied_instance = instance.clone()

    as you see, no print statement executed, meaning that the __init__() method didnt get called. you copied the instance with all of its attributes.

API Reference

class core.design_patterns.prototype.Prototype

The prototype object

clone()

The method that enables prototyping.
